directions: Melt butter in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Add leeks and sauté until tender, about 10 minutes. Add 2 cups water, carrots, beans, pear and rosemary; bring soup to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer until carrots are tender, about 15 minutes.

Purée soup in 2 batches in blender until smooth. Return to saucepan; mix in half and half. Thin with additional water by 1/4 cupfuls, if desired. Season soup with salt and pepper. Rewarm if necessary. Ladle soup into bowls and serve.
ingredients: 1 cup thinly sliced leeks (white and pale green parts only)
1 15- to 16-ounce can Great Northern beans, drained
2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary or 1 1/2 teaspoons dried
title: Cream of Carrot, White Bean and Pear Soup
